text: At 12:20 PM CET (11:20 UTC) on 29 December 2020, an earthquake of magnitude 6.4 (6.2 ) hit the Sisak-Moslavina County, Croatia, with an epicenter west- southwest of Petrinja. Seven people were confirmed dead, while 26 others were injured, with six having serious injuries. Many buildings in Petrinja were destroyed. The mayor of Petrinja Darinko DumboviÄ‡ said that half of the town has been destroyed. ==References== Category:2020 disasters in Europe Category:December 2020 events Category:Earthquakes in Europe Category:2020 earthquakes Category:2020s in Croatia Category:Sisak-Moslavina County
title: 2020 Petrinja earthquake
